intro: Arrabidaea brachypoda var. induta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
